text: [Music]
my name is Luke Jordan I am the
executive director of grass root grass
root is a nonprofit technology startup
that enables communities in South Africa
to give effect to participate read amok
recei through building and deploying
cutting-edge technology grassroots
mission is to enable ordinary people who
are trying to lead their communities
people who are trying to organize their
community in pursuit of some common goal
whether that's a goal they hold in
common that they achieve themselves or
something that requires them to interact
with government or the state or other
larger organizations and what we do is
we build really simple tools that help
them do things that people in offices
take for granted consider quite easy so
things like calling large-scale meetings
asking for volunteers requesting
information taking votes and we build
tools that allow them to do that in
communities that are extremely
low-income where unemployment is
pervasive most people don't have access
to good technology that most of us do so
we cross over the digital divide and
create these tools that let them do
those things on any kind of phone with
any kind of data bandwidth in any kind
of situation we were born in the cloud
and I will say I mean at present
grassroots currently serves over 300,000
users and has a few thousand activities
a month running through it with a team
of sort of three people and there's
absolutely no possibility we could have
done that without the cloud at the core
of our application we have a ec2 and RDS
stack quite common but increasingly over
the last year we've been moving more and
more towards fully managed in service
services so increasingly we develop not
just cloud first but serving us first so
we're using lambdas quite as quite
extensively we're using dynamically be
quite a lot even where we can't go
serving us we are using managed
containers so we use Fargate for a
couple of our services and we started
playing around with a couple of the
machine learning services where actually
were whitelisted for Amazon personalized
so we're exploring that
and we've been using recognition on a
couple of functions but really our
ultimate mission is to fundamentally
change the way the texture of community
life in South Africa and to change the
way that citizens engage with democracy
and engage with the state and to make
that fundamentally more participative
more deliberative and to do that really
at a scale that touches most of the
country so we see ourselves having
millions 10 million 15 million users
within South Africa using us on a highly
frequent basis and doing that in a way
that really changes the way the national
conversation happens and then outside of
the borders we've primarily focused on
South Africa for various reasons but at
some point we will look around at the
rest of sub-saharan Africa and other
countries around the world where the
context is relevant
